name: TimeTracking-WorkerTimeBlocks-GET-getWorkerTimeBlocks_1
description: [Time Tracking] GET /workerTimeBlocks — Retrieves time blocks for specified workers over a date range.

schema.name: fromDate
schema.description: The start date of the time block date range, using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: phase
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the project plan phase for the time block.
You can specify 1 or more project plan phase query parameters. 
You can use a returned id from the GET /planPhases endpoint in the Projects REST web service.

schema.name: project
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the project for the time block.
You can specify 1 or more project query parameters.
You can use a returned id from the GET /projects endpoint in the Projects REST web service.

schema.name: projectPlanTask
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the project plan task for the time block.
You can specify 1 or more project plan task query parameters.
You can use a returned id from the GET /planTasks endpoint in the Projects REST web service.

schema.name: status
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the approval status of the worker time block. Valid IDs are:

* Submitted: dd817fe688db4ac7bf84e3ef79f72948

* Unsubmitted (Not Submitted): ddf5968e6d4430ca4bce9a4cfaba337

* Approved: 0391102bd1b542538d996936c8fa2fa7

* Denied: 8fee8e9d07554b968bb1f19e679e5a05

* Sent Back: 070b249867f747a19bca64f73eafc9b8

You can specify 1 or more status query parameters.

schema.name: toDate
schema.description: The end date of the time block date range, using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

schema.name: worker
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the worker for the time block. Specify workers that the user has permission to access.
You can specify 1 or more worker query parameters.
You can use returned ids from GET /workers.

schema.description: The date and time of the simulated time clock event using the yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss format.

schema.name: eventType
schema.description: The Workday ID of the event type for the simulated time clock event.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: timeZone
schema.description: The Workday ID of the time zone for the simulated time clock event.

schema.name: worker
schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker for the simulated time clock event.
